intro: Helipterum gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and is well adapted to arid environments. Helipterum gnaphaloides is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
